#summary menuitem widget reference

= menuitem widget =

A [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkMenuItem.html GtkMenuItem], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/gtk-gtkcheckmenuitem.html#GtkCheckMenuItem GtkCheckMenuItem], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkRadioMenuItem.html GtkRadioMenuItem] or [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkImageMenuItem.html GtkImageMenuItem]

----

== Definition ==

{{{
<menuitem tag_attr="value"...>
	<label>text</label>
	<variable>varname</variable>
	<height>value</height>
	<width>value</width>
	<input>command</input>
	<input file>filename</input>
	<sensitive>state</sensitive>
	<action>activity</action>...
	<action signal="type">activity</action>...
	<action type="function">parameter</action>...
	<output file>filename</output>
</menuitem>
}}}

"..." denotes acceptance of multiples of the same thing.

== Tag Attributes ==

See the [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkMenuItem.html#GtkMenuItem.object-hierarchy GtkMenuItem], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/gtk-gtkcheckmenuitem.html#gtk-gtkcheckmenuitem.object-hierarchy GtkCheckMenuItem], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkRadioMenuItem.html#GtkRadioMenuItem.object-hierarchy GtkRadioMenuItem] or [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkImageMenuItem.html#GtkImageMenuItem.object-hierarchy GtkImageMenuItem] widget and ancestor class properties.

== Signals ==

The default signal for the checkbox and radiobutton menuitem widgets is "[http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/gtk-gtkcheckmenuitem.html#GtkCheckMenuItem-toggled toggled]", emitted when the state is changed, otherwise the default signal is "[http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkMenuItem.html#GtkMenuItem-activate activate]", emitted when the item is activated.

All widgets emit the "activate" signal.

The "file-changed" signal is emitted if file-monitor is true and the input file being monitored has changed.

The following signals are connected-up for all widgets:

[http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-button-press-event button-press-event], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-button-release-event button-release-event], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-configure-event configure-event], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-enter-notify-event enter-notify-event], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-leave-notify-event leave-notify-event], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-focus-in-event focus-in-event], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-focus-out-event focus-out-event], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-hide hide], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-show show], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-realize realize], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-key-press-event key-press-event], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-key-release-event key-release-event], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-map-event map-event], [http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/2.24/GtkWidget.html#GtkWidget-unmap-event unmap-event]

== Notes ==

1. SHIFT is 1, CTRL is 4 and ALT is 8 and you can OR them together.

2. Theme icons default to 16 and do not scale or refresh (the height or width directives can be used to request a size).

3. The input file directive is used exclusively by the checkbox and radiobutton menuitem widgets since the "image-name" custom tag attribute would contain any image filename.

4. The checkbox and radiobutton menuitem widgets support conditional function execution by prepending _function_:_parameter_ with {{{if true}}} or {{{if false}}}.
